revised_title: Catalytic Decomposition of Heterocyclic Compounds: Molybdenum and Nickel Sulphide Catalysts
tldr: This article investigates the catalytic decomposition of simple heterocyclic compounds, focusing on the preparation and properties of molybdenum sulphide and nickel sulphide catalysts. The authors examine the adsorption of hydrogen and heterocyclic compounds on these catalysts and study the chemical equilibria in the reduction of nickel sulphide. They propose two separate mechanisms by which molybdenum sulphide and nickel subsulphide function in the catalytic decomposition process.
